title: Danny Amendola shined when Patriots needed him most
text:
Danny Amendola shined when Patriots needed him most Dan Ventura Monday, October 26, 2015 Photo by: Matt Stone FLYING HIGH: Danny Amendola makes a spectacular leaping grab in the fourth quarter of yesterday’s win over the Jets in Foxboro. Photo by: Nancy Lane Cornerback Malcolm Butler breaks up a pass intended for New York Jets wide receiver Eric Decker in the first quarter. Photo by: Nancy Lane Jets cornerback Darrin Walls is wrapped up by the New England Patriots in the first quarter. Photo by: Nancy Lane Tight end Rob Gronkowski is hauled down by New York Jets free safety Marcus Gilchrist in the fourth quarter. Photo by: Nancy Lane Tight end Rob Gronkowski celebrates his fourth quarter touchdown. Photo by: Nancy Lane Tom Brady goes over the top for a touchdown in the second quarter. Photo by: Matt Stone Tight end Rob Gronkowski drags New York Jets free safety Marcus Gilchrist during the fourth quarter. Photo by: Matt Stone Quarterback Tom Brady dives in the end zone during the second quarter of the NFL game against the New York Jets. Photo by: Matt Stone Tight end Rob Gronkowski pushes off New York Jets free safety Marcus Gilchrist as he runs for a first down. Photo by: Nancy Lane Wide receiver Danny Amendola is taken down by New York Jets defensive back Buster Skrine after making a catch in the fourth quarter. Photo by: Matt Stone Tight end Rob Gronkowski celebrates with the Minutemen after beating the New York Jets 30-23. prev next comments Tweet FOXBORO — On a day when receivers were dropping passes left and right, Danny Amendola proved to be one of the most sure-handed.
The veteran wideout was targeted nine times and caught eight passes for 86 yards, including the go-ahead touchdown with 7:16 left, as the Patriots defeated the Jets, 30-23, yesterday at Gillette Stadium.
“The Jets always come to play,” Amendola said. “I knew we were going to be in for a battle for four quarters, and that’s what we got.”
Amendola had a sense early in the week that the wide receivers and tight ends were going to play a pivotal role. That was certainly the case as the Patriots all but gave the running game the day off (nine carries, four by quarterback Tom Brady).
“We wanted to play fast to try and tire their defense down,” Amendola said. “We wanted to get in and out of plays fast, getting in and out of the huddle and going quickly, so that was our motive.”
The stats would seem to indicate that the Jets might have gotten fatigued in the final 15 minutes. Brady threw for 150 yards and two touchdowns in the fourth quarter alone, including an 8-yard heat-seeking missile to Amendola over the middle. Amendola was able to ward off a hit from free safety Marcus Gilchrist before bouncing into the end zone to put the Patriots up, 23-20.
“It’s just a play we’ve been working on for a long time,” Amendola said. “They gave us the coverage that we liked and it ended up working out.”
As vital as Amendola’s touchdown was, his biggest contribution came on the final drive. He aggressively attacked a short Steve Weatherford punt at his own 21-yard line and returned it 11 yards to the 32 with 5:39 left. Usually, this is when receiver Julian Edelman comes to the forefront. But with Jets cornerback Darrelle Revis covering Edelman, Amendola became the go-to guy on the drive. He caught three passes for 31 yards, including a crucial 11-yarder on a third-and-10 from the Jets 33 to move the chains.
“Danny made some great plays like he always does for us — big catches over the middle, big catch on the sideline,” coach Bill Belichick said. “He did a good job inside there like he always does, gave us field position in the return game as well.”
Two plays after the big third-down catch, Brady connected with tight end Rob Gronkowski on a 15-yard TD strike with 1:18 left to boost the lead to 30-20. The play loomed larger later when Nick Folk kicked a 55-yard field goal and the Jets recovered an onside kick with 18 seconds left.
“They manned it up a lot on that last drive, specifically,” Amendola said of the Jets’ coverage. “We needed to score, had to score. (Gronkowski) made a great play right there at the end to get the ball in the end zone.”
